{"step_by_step_thinking": "First, we need to understand what the numbers 74 and 85 mean. In dental notation, these numbers refer to specific teeth. 74 is the lower right second primary molar and 85 is the lower left second primary molar. These are both primary or 'baby' teeth. When these teeth are extracted, it's important to maintain the space for the permanent teeth to erupt properly. A bilateral band and loop space maintainer is used when primary molars are lost on both sides of the dental arch, which is the case here.", "answer_choice": "A"}
